section_path: Present on Admission Guidelines > Assigning the POA Indicator > Documentation does not indicate whether condition was present on admission

content.full_text: Assign 'U' when the medical record documentation is unclear as to whether the condition was present on admission. 'U' should not be routinely assigned and used only in very limited circumstances. Coders are encouraged to query the providers when the documentation is unclear. (Evidence: pg no: 118, L33-L34)
content.summary: Use U indicator only when documentation is unclear about POA status, and query providers when possible (Evidence: pg no: 118, L33-L34)
key_concepts: U indicator assignment (Evidence: pg no: 118, L34)
Limited use circumstances (Evidence: pg no: 118, L34)
Provider query encouragement (Evidence: pg no: 118, L34)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Assign U when documentation is unclear about POA status (Evidence: pg no: 118, L34)
detailed_rules.explanation: The U indicator should only be used when medical record documentation does not provide sufficient information to determine POA status (Evidence: pg no: 118, L33-L34)

detailed_rules.rule_text: U should not be routinely assigned and used only in very limited circumstances (Evidence: pg no: 118, L34)
detailed_rules.explanation: The U indicator is not a default option and should be used sparingly only when truly necessary (Evidence: pg no: 118, L34)
common_applications: Last resort when documentation is truly unclear

detailed_rules.rule_text: Query providers when documentation is unclear (Evidence: pg no: 118, L34)
detailed_rules.explanation: Coders should attempt to clarify unclear documentation through provider queries before assigning U (Evidence: pg no: 118, L34)

workflow_steps: Step 2: Attempt to determine POA status using other guidelines
Step 3: Query provider if documentation unclear
Step 4: Only assign U if truly unable to determine

code_categories_mentioned: All conditions with unclear POA documentation

coding_scenarios.scenario: Documentation does not clearly indicate when condition developed
coding_scenarios.documentation_example: Patient has pneumonia, timing of development unclear from documentation
step_by_step: Step 1: Review all documentation for timing clues
Step 2: Apply other POA guidelines if possible
Step 4: If still unclear, assign U

correct_coding.primary_code: Pneumonia with U indicator (after query attempt)
correct_coding.rationale: Documentation unclear and provider query unsuccessful (Evidence: pg no: 118, L33-L34)

incorrect_coding.code: Pneumonia with U indicator without query attempt
incorrect_coding.rationale: Should query provider before assigning U
incorrect_coding.common_mistake: Using U as default for unclear cases without query

warnings: U should not be routinely assigned (Evidence: pg no: 118, L34)
Use only in very limited circumstances (Evidence: pg no: 118, L34)
best_practices: Always query providers when documentation is unclear (Evidence: pg no: 118, L34)
Exhaust other POA guidelines before using U (Evidence: pg no: 118, L33-L34)
common_mistakes: Using U as default for difficult cases (Evidence: pg no: 118, L34)
Not querying providers before assigning U (Evidence: pg no: 118, L34)
tips: Review all documentation thoroughly before considering U (Evidence: pg no: 118, L33-L34)
Document query attempts (Evidence: pg no: 118, L34)
implementation_notes: Establish query processes for unclear POA cases
clinical_context: Some documentation may genuinely lack POA timing information
